titles.title: To amend the Act entitled "An Act to provide for the extension of certain Federal benefits, services, and assistance to the Pascua Yaqui Indians of Arizona, and for other purposes".

action.text: Sponsor introductory remarks on measure. (CR E232)
Referred to the House Committee on Natural Resources.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Native American Affairs.
Executive Comment Requested from Interior.
Subcommittee Hearings Held.
Subcommittee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.
Forwarded by Subcommittee to Full Committee.
Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.

calendar.text: Ordered to be Reported by Voice Vote.
Placed on the Union Calendar, Calendar No. 115.

action.text: Reported by the Committee on Natural Resources. H. Rept. 103-204.
Mr. Richardson moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
Received in the Senate and read twice and referred to the Committee on Indian Affairs.
Committee on Indian Affairs. Hearings held.

calendar.text: Committee on Indian Affairs. Ordered to be reported with an amendment favorably.

action.text: Committee on Indian Affairs. Reported to Senate by Senator Inouye with an amendment. With written report No. 103-338.

calendar.text: Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 575.

vote.text: Passed Senate with an amendment by Voice Vote.

action.text: Message on Senate action sent to the House.
Mr. Richardson moved that the House suspend the rules and agree to the Senate amendment.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate.

vote.text: On motion that the House suspend the rules and agree to the Senate amendment Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

bill.summary: 8/19/1994--Passed Senate amended. Extends: (1) Federal recognition to the Pasqua Yaqui Indians of Arizona (the Tribe) as an historic tribe; and (2) the enrollment deadline for all U.S. citizens of Yaqui blood who apply for enrollment in the Tribe within three years after enactment of this Act. Directs the Secretary of the Interior, with tribal participation, to study the adequacy of the Tribe's land, water, and funding resources. Authorizes appropriations.
